wikipedia_page.main: Charles Philip Leese (22 May 1889 – 19 January 1947) was an English cricketer active from 1908 to 1911 who played for Lancashire. He was born in Manchester and died in Shropshire. He appeared in 16 first-class matches as a righthanded batsman, scoring 341 runs with a highest score of 48 and held five catches.Leese married Ethel Speakman, but they divorced, and she later married architect Maxwell Fry.
